alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Logan; Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:48PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Oklahoma, western Lincoln and southeastern Logan Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 148 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Guthrie, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Edmond, Guthrie, Langston, Coyle, and Meridian. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 144 and 155. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
